meanings.definition: The act of dividing into smaller parts or portions.
meanings.sent1: The fractioning of the cake into equal slices was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: She learned about fractioning in math class when dividing shapes.
meanings.sent3: The fractioning of the puzzle pieces made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent4: His fractioning of time between work and play was well-balanced.
meanings.sent5: The fractioning of the ingredients in the recipe was crucial for the dish to turn out right.

meanings.definition: The process of separating or breaking down into fractions.
meanings.sent1: Fractioning the liquid into smaller containers helped with storage.
meanings.sent2: The fractioning of the data allowed for better analysis.
meanings.sent3: The fractioning of the colors in the painting created a unique effect.
meanings.sent4: She felt like fractioning her thoughts helped clear her mind.
meanings.sent5: The fractioning of the budget into categories made it easier to manage finances.
